p.s: The short speech from US-president Barack Obama Remarks of president Barack Obama at student roundtable, delievereddelivered on April 7, 2009 in Istanbul, Turkey at the Culture and Arts Center of Mimar Sinan Fine Arts University in Tophane deals about the importance of intercultural understanding and student exchanges and tries to raise awareness on this topic.

The text can be divided into five parts, starting off with an introduction, he wants to rebuild the connection between the US and the Muslim world, which relies on mutual interest and respect (ll. 1-3).

In the next paragraph (ll. 4-8), Barack Obama praises the American people for their spirit of activism and responsibility (l. 4) for example, the young Americans teaching and volunteering abroad (l. 4-5).
This also applies to people around the world (ll. 7-8).
The next part (ll. 9-12), deals about the role he has a president in connecting young Americans to people all over the world (ll. 9-10) and how America influences the world by doing this (ll. 11-12).
In the next paragraph (ll. 13-17), he says that exchanges can help for people coming together and overlook their differences to pursuit a life thatsthat's purposeful (ll. 13-16).
This helps starting the progress in intercultural understanding (l. 17).

In his conclusion (ll. 18-22), he calls for action by telling his listeners that they are able to form the world to a better place (ll. 18-20) and that they can rely on the help of the United States (ll. 21-22).
In conclusion, Barack Obama is succesfulsuccessful in raising awareness on the importance of intercultural understanding and student exchanges.
